trans-unit.source: If the string is an indirect string (a string beginning with the "@" symbol), it is in the following form.

seg-source.mrk: If the string is an indirect string (a string beginning with the "@" symbol), it is in the following form.

target.mrk: If the string is an indirect string (a string beginning with the "@" symbol), it is in the following form.

trans-unit.source: @filename,resource

seg-source.mrk: @filename,resource

target.mrk: @filename,resource

trans-unit.source: The string is extracted from the file named, using the resource value as a locator. If the resource value is

If the resource value is

target.mrk: The string is extracted from the file named, using the resource value as a locator.

trans-unit.source: zero or greater, the number becomes the index of the string in the binary file. If the number is negative,

trans-unit.source: it becomes a resource ID. An indirect string can be appended with a version modifier, as shown here:

trans-unit.source: @filename,resource;v2

trans-unit.source: This form can be used when a string is changed but still uses the same index or resource ID as the old string.

seg-source.mrk: This form can be used when a string is changed but still uses the same index or resource ID as the old string.

target.mrk: This form can be used when a string is changed but still uses the same index or resource ID as the old string.

trans-unit.source: If the input string is not an indirect string, the function returns an input string unchanged.
